comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/55598796@N07] Hi Mark, glad you love the photo of old Karl Oskar! The photo has no known copyright restrictions and you may absolutely use it on your website. (I can't find it though...) We're very pleased if you link back to this page (or mention the name of the photographer) and give credit to Swedish National Heritage Board as the source. We don't hold the copyright though - the photo is free to use. Thanks for asking! :)
/Anna B.

comment.author: 78675794@N03
comment._content: I think this photo id great!!!  This man could have been an ex-Confederate soldier or a patriarch of a family based in the Virginia, Georgia, Tennessee, or Kentucky mountains. A story of struggle and conflicting ideals.  His face tells a story and says, "I've seen some messed up stuff".  Wisdom, mistakes, and heartaches.

comment.author: 60208968@N08
comment._content: The beard...the hand made suit...the deep set eyes..the old growth cabin logs as a backdrop...the lighting...all are exceptional but that comb over, it is the icing on his cake and I can only imagine he took great care to get it just right and waxed just right and obviously was very important to him. Fantastic photo.

comment.author: 42445979@N03
comment._content: Amazingly sharp image - wild beard, and piercing eyes.
